alert.note: Alert for Clay; Cloud; Dickinson; Geary; Marshall; Morris; Nemaha; Ottawa; Pottawatomie; Republic; Riley; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 12 at 2:17PM CDT until April 13 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 008, 009, 010, 020, 021, 022, 023, AND 034... ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CDT THURSDAY FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 008, 009, 010, 020, 021, 022, 023, AND 034... The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon to 8 PM CDT Thursday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 008, 009, 010, 020, 021, 022, 023, and 034. * TODAY...South to southwest winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts of 25 to 35 mph. Relative humidity in the 20 to 25 percent range. * THURSDAY...South to southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts 30 to 40 mph. Relative humidity in the 18 to 25 percent range. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Cloud; Dickinson; Geary; Marshall; Morris; Nemaha; Ottawa; Pottawatomie; Republic; Riley; Washington
